Job Title: MEP Estimator III

Location: Minneapolis, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
As a Top 25 builder, developer, and EPC, our expertise spans markets like sports, renewable energy, data centers, healthcare, and more. We are builders at heart, working to ensure the built environment has a lasting positive impact. | Let’s Redefine Possible® 

Responsible for leading estimating efforts of gathering, calculating, and compiling data to produce project estimates for multiple projects, as well as providing support for large projects. 

Responsibilities

Organize, plan and schedule for estimate preparation.

Facilitate meetings necessary for completion of estimate, including kick off, status updates, plan flips, final reviews, etc.Assign work to ensure complete and reliable estimate incorporating all relevant information, including, but not limited to contract documents, communication with design team and owner, tax laws, collective bargaining agreements, permits and other regulatory requirements, etc. Adjust assignments as necessary to complete the estimate in time allotted.Work with project team to determine trade partner strategy and prepare invitation to bid / budget to guarantee complete pricing coverage.Obtain all relevant documents including BIM (Building Information Model) necessary to complete quantity survey and to assist in understanding of project. Promote collaboration between all parties to ensure complete understanding of scope that leads to comprehensive Scope and Budget Alignment.Ensure completion of changes discussed in estimate reviews.Ensure complete Quantity Survey of materials / resources required to complete the project - Use knowledge of project type and construction best practices to “fill in the gaps” in early design documents to ensure a complete and thorough estimate that reflects the total scope of work necessary.Work with project team to determine site logistic and schedule requirements and prepare general requirements estimateUtilize cost history to inform scope, pricing, productivities, etc.Work with Project Sponsor and Estimating Leaders to ensure estimate that meets company and group margin goals. Work with Project Team to prepare and present margin plan for approval by project and group leaders.Work with Estimating Leaders to prepare for, participate in and manage Bid Day or presentation to ownerElectronically file appropriate documents. For commercial projects archive in Eos Cortex and Estimate Change Log.Cost modeling, value analysis and target value deliveryProvide system area quantity survey and cost history (utilizing Eos Cortex) to price cost model and establish target budgets in concert with estimating leadership.Utilize estimate, industry knowledge, etc. to provide value analysis to maintain project budgetsPerform cost studies to assist design team in selection of building systems, materials and other design requirements. Assist Design Phase Team in steering design to budget.Self-Performed Work expertise – prepare or supervise preparation of all self-performed work scopes utilizing appropriate levels of detail and TCH (Task Code History) to accurately price the work

Cost History

Work with Estimating Leaders, project team and visit project sites to ensure proper allocation and reporting of costs, work hours and quantities to ensure reliability of cost data for use in future estimates.Work with Estimating Leaders and Company Cost Historian to record final estimate and, upon project completion, final costs using Eos Cortex for use in cost modeling and in setting targets for future projects.Maintain communication with project leadership throughout the project to learn challenges and opportunities encountered to inform future estimates.Build and maintain relationships with Operations Personnel, design partners, trade partners and owners during estimate and beyond.Works in collaboration with other team membersExhibit strong work ethic, self-starter habits, resourcefulness and business judgement, using the principles of LeadBLU.Actively participate in and prepare topics for group estimating meetings and other company meetings as needed.Assist in group / company initiatives as needed.Develop industry knowledge base – utilize all available resources, trade journals, conferences, work on projects, etc. to develop and maintain knowledge of industry best practices, trends and challenges.Consistently advances the capabilities of the group through involvement in group and company initiatives and through coaching of less experienced team members.Effectively work and build relationships with those of diverse backgrounds and organizational levels

Qualifications

Associate or Bachelor’s degree in Estimating, Engineering, Construction Management, or equivalent field experience Minimum six years construction industry experienceDetail orientation; proven ability to organize and manage multiple project tasksFamiliarity with building and estimating techniques and softwareAble to lead multiple projects simultaneously.Able to use BIM, plans and other project documents to successfully quantify the work.Builds industry relationships and works to increase knowledge of all building systemsProven ability to lead teams of estimators on larger projects. Demonstrated ability to use cost history software in pricing work at micro level (unit prices) as well as macro level (building systems). Able to complete self-performed estimates, including general conditions, effectively analyzing data from past projects to price. Understands impacts of schedule and logistics on an estimate and effectively includes those impacts in estimates. Ability to travel up to 20%Ability to perform quantity survey for a MEP system and can size equipment and perform layouts of devices along distribution for focused system (Mechanical/Plumbing or Electrical/Technology).Ability to identify and create value analysis for a project, validate design and identify shortcomings, gaps, or overdesign. Correctly analyzes Cortex to evaluate and validate estimates for a project for true comparable projectsUnderstands productivity (MCA/SMACNA/NECA) and how to apply it to estimated labor, understanding local labor ratesFull knowledge and understanding of one scope (M/P or E/T) with ability to identify and coordinate scopes of work outside of MEPT but necessary for the installation of MEPT systems such as supplemental steel and concrete.Build and maintain relationships with trade partners for focused areaBuild and maintain relationships with design engineersAwareness of potential code impacts due to adoption of new codes

Benefits

Mortenson provides a comprehensive benefits program to team members and their families to support their health, build long-term financial security and provide the opportunity for work and life balance. Benefits offered to non-craft, non-union, full-time team members include:

Medical and prescription drug plans – the choice between two affordable HSA-eligible medical plans that include vision coverageDental plan401k retirement plan with generous matching and profit-sharing contributionsPaid time off, holidays, and other paid leavesLife, AD&D, and disability insuranceEmployee assistance program online mental health tool and conciergeTuition reimbursementAdoption Assistance Gym Membership Discount Program Identity Theft Protection 

Mortenson is an EOE/Affirmative Action/M/F/Veteran/Disabled employer.

Visa sponsorship is not offered for this position.

Mortenson reserves the right to hire any individual without legal or financial obligation on unwanted solicitations. No agency emails, calls, or solicitations are accepted without a valid agreement.

Experience Level (if available): None
